page.title: 16COURT GRANGE R.N.I.D.
page.content: Court Grange is a huge house once belonging to Captain and Mrs Hare. Sadly Captain Hare was drowned whilst commanding H.M.S Eurydice in 1843. In memory of her husband Mrs Hare raised Â£1609 for the church. Court Grange was given to the Royal National Institute for the Blind.The house has 28 bedrooms and would probably accommodate nearly a hundred children. Now it is used for deaf and dumb students.Most of the children who go there are boys.The age range is 16-22 years.Boys play sporting games like football.Recently a swimming pool has been built in the garden.We rang up the secretary of Court Grange and asked her a few questions.33 students go there and yet 40 staff are needed. Although no new buildings are being built a number of buildings are being changed.30-40 pupils go to the Grange.
